title: WP User Enumeration is possible at https://blog.dropbox.com
vulnerability_information:
Hello security team. I like to report this bug I found.

Here are some user ID's proofing user enumeration is possible.

User ID 2 : drew
User ID 4 : jon
User ID 6 : arash 
User ID 9 : dan
User ID 10 : arash-ferdowsi
User ID 11 : dropbox-team
User ID 13 : ivan 

It is recommended to rename the admin user account to reduce the chance of brute force attacks occurring. As this will reduce the chance of automated password attackers gaining access. However it is important to understand that if the author archives are enabled it is usually possible to enumerate all users within a WordPress installation.

Step to reproduce :

1. Click on the url and you will be redirect to the author login name.

PoC:
https://blog.dropbox.com/?author=2
https://blog.dropbox.com/?author=4
https://blog.dropbox.com/?author=6
https://blog.dropbox.com/?author=9
https://blog.dropbox.com/?author=10
 https://blog.dropbox.com/?author=11
https://blog.dropbox.com/?author=13

I did no test more ids and I did this test manually.

More information about this bug here:
http://www.acunetix.com/blog/articles/wordpress-username-enumeration-using-http-fuzzer/

Any problems reproducing this bug please let me know.

Regards.
Francisco.

Thanks for reaching out to us. 

Our security team has reviewed your report and are happy that this does not pose a security threat to Dropbox users. 

We do not consider Wordpress user IDs or usernames to be private information, and we rely on our own as well as Wordpress's security measures to prevent password bruteforcing or any other automated password attacks.

We look forward to receiving reports from you in future.
